comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Looking north west from Palm Beach across the end of Pittwater to Broken Bay and the Hawkesbury river. Barrenjoey headland on the right, West Head on the left. The cottage and jetty belonged to a Customs House set up to prevent smugglers bringing goods into Sydney via ‘the back door’, and it closed in 1900 (about the time of this photo, I think). More history and a couple of 1906 shots of the same buildings (the trees have grown, hence this photo is earlier) here – www.pittwater.nsw.gov.au/library/local_history/Pittwaters... Also an 1869 watercolour showing almost exactly this view with an earlier cottage in front of the brick chimney, (remarkable for getting the rocks detail right on the headland) – www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.pic-an6454687 And a view of the wharf from the right hand side – acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413731 I am trying to find out if that ship is the steamer “Florrie” as mentioned in the Mona Vale Library link above. Help!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Again, brilliant work! Thanks to you this previously unidentified photo has been identified as Broken Bay. 

We really thought this one was tricky, we'll have to work harder at that!
